Key Arguments: The legislation restricts freedom of speech.
Australians should have the right to hear all information, including misinformation and disinformation, and make their own judgments.
Government control over what is considered good or bad information is concerning.
The current debate on the Voice to Parliament illustrates the potential misuse of such powers.
There is a need for a constitutional right to free speech in Australia.
Notable Quotes: "Allowing a government organisation the right to determine what is good information or what is bad information is very troubling."
"What Australians need is a right to free speech inserted in our constitution."
